item.title: Redisæ¶æ„æ¼”è¿›
item.description: Rome wasn’t built in a day. How does Redis architecture evolve? Redis is a popular in-memory cache. How did it evolve to the architecture it is today? ğŸ”¹ 2010 - Standalone Redis When Redis 1.0 was released in 2010, the architecture was quite simple. It is usually used as a cache to the business application. However, Redis stores data in memory. When we restart Redis, we will lose all the data and the traffic directly hits the database.

item.title: Redisä¸ºå•¥è¿™ä¹ˆå¿«
item.description: Why is Redis Fast? Redis is fast for in-memory data storage. Its speed has made it popular for caching, session storage, and real-time analytics. But what gives Redis its blazing speed? Let’s explore: ğ—¥ğ—”ğ— -ğ—•ğ—®ğ˜€ğ—²ğ—± ğ—¦ğ˜ğ—¼ğ—¿ğ—®ğ—´ğ—² At its core, Redis primarily uses main memory for storing data. Accessing data from RAM is orders of magnitude faster than from disk. This is a major reason for Redis’s speed. However, RAM is volatile.
